snippet: Mitt Romney won handily in the Nevada caucuses with the help of groups he has struggled to persuade before, including strong Tea Party supporters and very conservative voters.
abstract: Mitt Romney wins the Nevada caucuses handily, solidifying his status as the front-runner in the race for the Republican nomination; it is Romney's second decisive victory in four days, following his first-place finish in Florida.

byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and JEFF ZELENY
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ashley Parker in Las Vegas, and Marjorie Connelly, David R. Jones, Allison Kopicki and Dalia Sussman in New York.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney won handily in the Nevada caucuses with the help of groups he has struggled to persuade before, including strong Tea Party supporters and very conservative voters.

headline.seo: Romney Takes a Solid Win in Nevada Caucuses, Fueling Momentum
headline.main: Romney Scores Nevada Victory With Broad G.O.P. Support
headline.print_headline: Romney Takes A Solid Victory In Nevada Vote
